info.headline: Dust Advisory issued September 1 at 6:17PM MST until September 1 at 7:15PM MST by NWS Phoenix AZ
info.description:
The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a
* Dust Advisory for... Maricopa County in south central Arizona... Pinal County in southeastern Arizona...
* Until 715 PM MST.
* At 616 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from 9 miles northeast of Estrella to 7 miles north of Freeman to 13 miles east of Big Horn, moving west at 20 mph.
HAZARD...Less than two miles visibility with strong wind in excess of 40 mph.
SOURCE...Doppler radar.
IMPACT...Hazardous travel.
* This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 8 between mile markers 111 and 155. AZ Route 238 between mile markers 1 and 36. AZ Route 85 between mile markers 1 and 8, and between mile markers 119 and 143.
Locations impacted include... Avondale, Goodyear, Gila Bend, Estrella, Big Horn, Bosque, Cotton Center, Painted Rock Dam, Freeman, Gila Bend Auxiliary Field, Sonoran National Monument, Mobile, and Rainbow Valley.
info.instruction:
Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
